hook.text: Blocking or removing the fallopian tubes permanently prevents eggs from reaching sperm.

buildup.text: Tubal ligation has been performed since the early 1900s and remains one of the most common surgeries worldwide.

discovery.text: Modern techniques use tiny incisions and can be done as outpatient procedures with quick recovery.

twist.text: Historically, forced sterilizations were performed on marginalized women, a dark chapter in medicine.

climax.text: Today, informed consent and patient autonomy are central to all sterilization decisions.

punchline.text: Permanent, effective, and now always a choice.

quiz.question: What does tubal ligation do?
options: Blocks or removes the fallopian tubes
